msg: I'll serve as the publicity chair for ICWSM 2024, please follow the @ICWSM on Twitter/X for updates
New preprint Artificial intelligence is ineffective and potentially harmful for fact checking available
I have joined Northeastern University as a postdoc

New preprint Anatomy of an AI-powered malicious social botnet available. Also check out the Tech Policy Press, MIT Technology Review, Business Insider, Wired, another Business Insider, and New York Post stories that cover this work
Our paper A Multi-Platform Collection of Social Media Posts about the 2022 U.S. Midterm Elections was published in the Proceedings of ICWSM
Please read the The Verge and iNews stories on how Twitter's decision to charge their API could impact research and tools such as Botometer
Please read my open letter with the Coalition for Independent Technology Research regarding Reddit's decesion to restrict its data access
I'm guest-editing a special issue Computational Approaches for Cyber Social Threats at EPJ Data Science; the submission deadline is 15 Sep 2023
I attended the WebConf23 in Austin, Texas organizing CySoc2023 Workshop
I defended my PhD dissertation ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰
Please read my open letter with the Coalition for Independent Technology Research regarding Twitter's decesion to discontinue free API access
New preprint Large language models can rate news outlet credibility available

Our paper Online misinformation is linked to early COVID-19 vaccination hesitancy and refusal was listed Scientific Reports' Top 100 most downloaded articles of 2022 and cited by the 2023 Economic Report of the President (Biden-Harris Administration)
Our paper One Year of COVID-19 Vaccine Misinformation on Twitter: Longitudinal Study was published in Journal of Medical Internet Research
I gave my talk 'Fantastic Bots and How to Find Them' at the Computational Methods Research Group at U Wisconsin-Madison and Social Computing Group at University of Zurich
I shared with CNN and Tech Policy Press my thoughts on how Twitter's decision to charge their API could impact our tools such as Botometer
Check out the new Hoaxy tool: now working with the Twitter API v2, a new 3D diffusion network visualization, faster labeling of likely automated accounts, and dark mode!
New preprint A multi-platform collection of social media posts about the 2022 U.S. midterm elections available
New preprint Network localization strength regulates innovation diffusion with macro-level social influence available

We are organizing the CySoc2023 Workshop at ACM Web Conference, if you work on topics related to cyber social threats such as misinformation, toxicity, and extremism, be sure to check out the CFP. Deadline is Feb. 6, 2023.
Check out our new tool US Midterm 2022 dashboard, which tracks the top misinformation sources and spreaders on multiple social media platforms
I gave a talk about my work on COVID-19 misinformation at the 2022 INFORMS Annual Meeting
New preprint Exposure to social bots amplifies perceptual biases and regulation propensity available
New preprint One year of COVID-19 vaccine misinformation on Twitter available
Our paper Comparing measures of centrality in bipartite patient-prescriber networks: A study of drug seeking for opioid analgesics was published in PLoS ONE
Our paper Botometer 101: social bot practicum for computational social scientists was published in Journal of Computational Social Science
I shared with BBC and CNN my thoughts on the use of Botometer by Musk's team in his dispute with Twitter recently
I appeared on Yahoo! Finance live commenting on using Botometer for bot detection and the Twitter/Musk lawsuit
I became an affiliate at Center for Information, Technology, and Public Life, UNC-Chapel Hill
Our paper How Twitter data sampling biases U.S. voter behavior characterizations was published in PeerJ Computer Science
New preprint The landscape of social bot research: a critical appraisal available
I gave a tutorial on how to identify social media manipulation using OSoMe tools at the 2022 Computation + Journalism Conference
I attended ICWSM in person. On Jun 6, I co-organized the CySoc workshop. On Jun 9, I chaired Session 8: Polarization 2. I also won the Best Reviewer Award
My comments on social bots were quoted by The Wall Street Journal, Politico, Yahoo News, and The Washington Post recently
Our paper The Manufacture of Partisan Echo Chambers by Follow Train Abuse on Twitter was published in the Proceedings of ICWSM
Our article How many bots are on Twitter? The question is difficult to answer and misses the point was published in The Conversation
Our paper Algorithmic Agents in the Hybrid Media System: Social Bots, Selective Amplification, and Partisan News about COVID-19 was published in Human Communication Research
Check out our new tool BotAmp, which can compare the bot amplification levels of two sets of tweets
Our paper Online misinformation is linked to early COVID-19 vaccination hesitancy and refusal was published in Scientific Reports
I defended my dissertation proposal ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰
I was selected for Future Leaders Summit 2022, University of Michigan
New preprint Botometer 101: Social bot practicum for computational social scientists available
Our paper Substitution of Nonpharmacologic Therapy With Opioid Prescribing for Pain During the COVID-19 Pandemic was published in JAMA Network Open
Our paper Systematic comparison of graph embedding methods in practical tasks was published in Physical Review E
Our paper Neutral bots probe political bias on social media was published in Nature Communications
Our paper Use of and Comorbidities Associated With Diagnostic Codes for COVID-19 in US Health Insurance Claims was published in JAMA Network Open
Our paper The Manufacture of Partisan Echo Chambers by Follow Train Abuse on Twitter was accepted to ICWSM'22
Our paper New means, new measures: Assessing prescription drug seeking indicators over ten years of the opioid epidemic was published in Addiction
New preprint Systematic comparison of graph embedding methods in practical tasks available
Our paper CoVaxxy: A Collection of English-Language Twitter Posts About COVID-19 Vaccines was published in the proceedings of ICWSM
I'll join TikTok (ByteDance) as an summer intern
I received the 2021 IU Luddy Outstanding Research Award
Our paper The COVID-19 Infodemic: Twitter versus Facebook was published in Big Data & Society
New preprint The impact of online misinformation on U.S. COVID-19 vaccinations available
Our paper Persona2vec: a flexible multi-role representations learning framework for graphs was published in PeerJ Computer Science
Our paper Systematic Evaluation of State Policy Interventions Targeting the US Opioid Epidemic, 2007-2018 was published in JAMA Network Open
Check out our new CoVaxxy tool to visualize the COVID-19 vaccine discussion on Twitter; the corresponding preprint is also available
Our paper Model-free hidden geometry of complex networks was published in Physical Review E
Check out our OSoMeTweet Python package to access Twitter's V2 API

New preprint Detection of Novel Social Bots by Ensembles of Specialized Classifiers available
